Identification.LongTitle: Tobacco Products Regulations (Plain and Standardized Appearance)

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to sections 7a and 33b of the Tobacco and Vaping Products Actc, makes the annexed Tobacco Products Regulations (Plain and Standardized Appearance).

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Tobacco and Vaping Products Act. (Loi)
carton means a secondary package that contains two or more primary packages. (cartouche)
drab brown means the colour known as Pantone 448 C. (brun terne)
gray means the colour known as Pantone Cool Gray 2 C. (gris)

health warning, in respect of a tobacco product, has the same meaning as in the Tobacco Products Information Regulations or the Tobacco Products Labelling Regulations (Cigarettes and Little Cigars), as applicable. (mise en garde)
lower slide-flap means, in respect of a slide and shell package, the lower extremity of the slide that can be folded and is concealed by the shell when the package is closed. (rabat inférieur)
primary package means any package — other than an overwrap — that is intended for retail sale in Canada and in which a tobacco product is directly placed. (emballage primaire)
secondary package means any package — other than an overwrap — that is intended for retail sale in Canada and in which a primary package is placed. (emballage secondaire)
slide means the sliding portion of a slide and shell package. (tiroir)

upper slide-flap means, in respect of a slide and shell package, the upper extremity of the slide that can be folded and is concealed by the shell when the package is closed and that is visible when the package is used in the customary manner to gain access to the tobacco product. (rabat supérieur)

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations, a reference to a common name is a reference to the common name that is shown on a label in accordance with subparagraph 10(b)(ii) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Act.

In these Regulations, a reference to a declaration of net quantity is a reference to the declaration of net quantity that is contained on a label in accordance with section 4 of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Act.
In these Regulations, a reference to an exterior surface of a package that contains a tobacco product is a reference,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, to the part of the package that forms, as the case may be, the exterior surface of the front, back, top, bottom or any of the sides of the package;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a cylindrical package,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to the part of the package that forms, as the case may be, the exterior surface of the top or bottom of the package when it is closed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to the part of the package that forms, as the case may be, the exterior curved surface that makes up the front or back of the package around its circumference; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other package, to the part of the package that forms, as the case may be, the exterior surface of the front, back, top, bottom or any of the sides of the package when it is closed.

Subsection.Text: In these Regulations, a reference to an interior or exterior surface of a package that contains a tobacco product does not include a reference to an overwrap.

Section.MarginalNote: Tobacco product and package — retail sale

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply to every package that contains a tobacco product and that is intended for retail sale in Canada, as well as to every tobacco product that is intended for retail sale in Canada.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Package that does not contain tobacco products
Subsection.Text: These Regulations also apply to a package that does not contain a tobacco product, if the package is furnished by a manufacturer of a tobacco product so that a tobacco product, primary package or secondary package may be placed in it after the tobacco product, primary package or secondary package is sold at retail in Canada.

Section.Text: These Regulations do not apply to a package that contains a tobacco product and that is intended to be distributed to a manufacturer or retailer.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a provision of these Regulations that applies to any interior surface of a primary package that contains cigarettes applies to each surface of the slide of a slide and shell package — including the upper slide-flap and lower slide-flap — with the exception of any surface that forms the exterior surface of the top or bottom of the package when it is closed.

For greater certainty, a provision of these Regulations that applies to any interior surface of a secondary package applies to each surface of a carton that forms its flaps and that is visible only when the carton is opened.

For the purposes of section 23 of the Act, these Regulations set out the requirements that manufacturers of tobacco products must meet in respect of the plain and standardized appearance, shape and content of tobacco product packages.

For the purposes of section 15.3 of the Act, these Regulations set out the requirements that manufacturers of tobacco products must meet in respect of the manner of displaying information on or in tobacco product packages, including the form and placement of the information.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 5 and 5.3 of the Act, these Regulations also establish standards that manufacturers of tobacco products must meet in respect of the plain and standardized appearance and shape of tobacco products and set out requirements that manufacturers must meet in respect of the markings that may be displayed on tobacco products.

Subsection.Text: A primary package may contain only a tobacco product, a lining and a leaflet.
A secondary package may contain only a primary package or other secondary package, as well as any overwrap covering those packages.

Section.Text: Every secondary package must have a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, having six surfaces that meet at right angles and edges that are rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling.

Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, the interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package must not display any brand element or any colour or information.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided by these Regulations, every interior and exterior surface of a primary package and of a secondary package must be drab brown.

Other colours may be used on the interior and exterior surfaces to display a health warning or other information that is required by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province in accordance with the requirements imposed by or under that Act, other Act of Parliament or Act of the legislature of a province.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — package made of metal or wood
Subsection.Text: An interior surface of a primary package that is made of metal or wood may be the natural colour of the metal or wood.

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, every interior and exterior surface of a primary package and of a secondary package must have a matte finish.
Any adhesive substance that is used on an interior or exterior surface of a primary package or of a secondary package or on any lining or overwrap must be transparent and colourless.

Subsection.Text: Every interior and exterior surface of a primary package and of a secondary package, as well as any overwrap covering the package, must have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities.
However, a carton may include a perforated strip for opening that, once torn, may leave serrations on the carton’s interior and exterior surfaces.

The interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package, as well as any lining, leaflet and overwrap, must not include any feature that is designed to change the appearance (such as heat-activated ink) or to change the surface area (such as a fold-out panel) of the package, lining, leaflet or overwrap.
A primary package must be designed in such a manner that it may be opened by only one means when the package is used in the customary manner to gain access to the tobacco product.
A primary package must not be designed in such a manner that it forms an inner box that can be removed without being damaged.

A primary package and a secondary package may display an alphanumeric code that is composed of no more than 10 numeric characters and either the abbreviation “CA” that represents Canada or one of the following internationally approved alpha codes that represents the province or territory where the product is sold:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Ontario, “ON”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Quebec, “QC”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Nova Scotia, “NS”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of New Brunswick, “NB”;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Manitoba, “MB”;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of British Columbia, “BC”;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Prince Edward Island, “PE”;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Saskatchewan, “SK”;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Alberta, “AB”;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Newfoundland and Labrador, “NL”;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Yukon, “YT”;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the Northwest Territories, “NT”; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of Nunavut, “NU”.

Subsection.Text: The alphanumeric code may be displayed on a primary package and a secondary package if it is displayed in such a manner that the code

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a matte finish and is printed in a regular weight and width Lucida Sans Serif font style, without italics, and in black or gray;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is printed only once on the primary package and once on the secondary package, in characters of no more than 8 points; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, is displayed on only the exterior surface of the top, bottom or any one of the sides of the package.

Subsection.Text: The alphanumeric code must not convey any information relating to characteristics of the tobacco product that the package contains or the tobacco product’s emissions.
The alphanumeric code must not evoke the tobacco product’s brand elements.
A primary package and a secondary package may display a bar code that is rectangular in shape, does not contain any image or design and is no more than 40 mm by 20 mm in size.
The bar code may be displayed on a primary package and a secondary package if it is displayed in such a manner that the code

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has a matte finish and is printed in either black and white or in drab brown and white;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is displayed only once on the primary package and once on the secondary package; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, is displayed on only the exterior surface of the top, bottom or any one of the sides of the package.

Subsection.Text: The interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package, as well as any lining, leaflet and overwrap, must not include any feature that is designed to permit access remotely to any promotion by a means of electronic communication.

The surfaces, lining, leaflet and overwrap may include a feature that is designed to permit access remotely to other types of information by a means of electronic communication if the feature becomes visible only through technological means or meets the requirements imposed by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province.
A feature that is designed to prevent counterfeiting may be displayed on an exterior surface of a primary package or of a secondary package if the feature

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is required under an enactment of a foreign government;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a QR code, DotCode or Data Matrix;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is rectangular in shape and does not contain any image or design;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is no more than 40 mm by 20 mm in size;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: has a matte finish and is printed in either black and white or in drab brown and white;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is displayed only once on each package; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, is displayed on only the exterior surface of the top, bottom or any one of the sides of the package.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Definition of QR code, DotCode and Data Matrix
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, QR code, DotCode and Data Matrix have the same meanings as in Article 21 of the Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2018/574 of December 15, 2017 on Technical Standards for the Establishment and Operation of a Traceability System for Tobacco Products.

Section.Text: Calibration marks that are necessary for the automated manufacturing of a primary package or of a secondary package may be displayed on any of its interior or exterior surfaces, if those marks are not visible when the package is used in the customary manner to gain access to the tobacco product.

Subsection.Text: The interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package, as well as any lining, leaflet and overwrap, must not be capable of emitting a scent or sound.
However, the interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package that are made of wood may emit the natural scent of the wood.

Section.Text: The interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package must not include any cut-out window that permits the contents of the package to be visible without opening it.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (5), the interior and exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package must not include any sticker or tab.

An exterior surface of a primary package and of a secondary package may include an irremovable sticker that displays information required by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, if the sticker is placed on the package in such a manner that it does not conceal or obscure any such information on the package.
The sticker is deemed to form a part of the surface on which it is placed.
However, only the requirements of sections 9 to 12, subsections 13(1) and 14(1) and sections 17 and 20 apply to the sticker.
An interior and exterior surface of a primary package that is a pouch or a soft package may include a rectangular tab for resealing the package after opening if the tab

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not conceal or obscure any information required by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not display any brand element or any information.

Subsection.Text: Only the requirements of subsection 10(1) and sections 11 and 12, subsections 13(1), 14(1) and 17(1) and section 20 apply to the tab.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Transparent and colourless sticker or tab
Subsection.Text: Any tab or sticker that covers any information required by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province must be transparent and colourless.

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided by these Regulations, any lining that is placed in a primary package must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be white or drab brown;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have a matte finish and no variations in colour tone;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not display any brand element or any information; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities aside from embossed dots or squares that are required for the automated manufacturing process and that are uniform in size and equidistant.

Section.Text: Except as otherwise provided by these Regulations, any overwrap that covers a primary package or secondary package must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: mould to the primary package or secondary package that it covers;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be transparent and colourless;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: not include any tear tape;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: not display any brand element; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: not display any information or features.

Section.MarginalNote: Overwrap — more than one primary package
Section.Text: If an overwrap covers more than one primary package, the following information and features may be displayed on it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: calibration marks that meet the requirements of section 19;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a bar code, if it is displayed only once on the overwrap, meets the requirements of subsection 16(1) and paragraph 16(2)(a) and is printed directly on the overwrap or on a label that meets the requirements of section 11 and subsections 13(1) and 14(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a solid black rectangle to cover the bar code on each primary package;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration of net quantity and the common name of the tobacco product, printed in white on a black rectangle, if they are oriented parallel to and in the same direction as any information that is displayed on the surface that the overwrap covers; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a health warning and any other information that is required or authorized by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province.

Section.Text: An overwrap that covers a primary package or secondary package may include a single tear tape that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is made of plastic, is transparent and is either colourless or the colour required by or under an Act of the legislature of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: forms a straight line that has a uniform width of no more than 3.5 mm around the package or the width required by or under an Act of the legislature of a province;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is parallel to any straight edge of the package and perpendicular to the opening of the package;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is designed in such a manner that the entire overwrap is removed once the tear tape is torn; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: displays only information that is required or authorized by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, any text that is displayed on a primary package or secondary package, or on any overwrap covering the package, must have a matte finish and be printed in a regular weight and width Lucida Sans Serif font style, without italics, and in gray.
The space between every word that forms part of an expression must be no more than 4 mm.

Section.MarginalNote: Brand name — no colour or filter characteristic
Section.Text: A brand name that is not prohibited by the Act may be displayed in accordance with these Regulations on a primary package and a secondary package, if the brand name does not evoke a colour or a characteristic of a filter.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a primary package or secondary package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, the brand name may be displayed only once on each exterior surface of the front, back, top, bottom and sides of the package.
Subject to subsection (3), the brand name may be displayed only once on each of the following surfaces of a cylindrical primary package or secondary package:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the exterior surface of the top and bottom of the package; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exterior curved surface of the front and back of the package.

Subsection.Text: The brand name may be displayed only once on a cigar tube.
In the case of any other package, the brand name may be displayed only once on each exterior surface of the package.
Any brand name that is displayed on a primary package or secondary package must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be printed in alphabetic characters of 14 points; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: form only one line of text.

Subsection.Text: Only the first letter of each word in the brand name may be a capital letter.

If a brand name is displayed on an exterior surface of a primary package or secondary package and a health warning is also displayed on that surface, the brand name must be oriented parallel to and in the same direction as the health warning and must be centered in the area of that surface that remains unoccupied by the health warning and any other information that is required or authorized by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province.
If a brand name is displayed on an exterior surface of a primary package or secondary package, and no health warning is displayed on that surface, the brand name must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: oriented parallel to and in the same direction as any other information that is displayed on that surface and centered in the remaining area of that surface; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: centered on that surface, if no other information is displayed on it.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to a cigar tube.

Heading.TitleText: Manufacturer Information and Declaration of Net Quantity

Section.MarginalNote: Manufacturer identity and principal place of business

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer’s identity and principal place of business may be displayed only once on every primary package and secondary package and must be printed in characters of 10 points.

In the case of a primary package or secondary package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, the manufacturer’s identity and principal place of business may be displayed on the exterior surface of only one of the sides of the package.

Section.Text: In the case of any package, other than a cylindrical package, the manufacturer’s identity and principal place of business must be oriented parallel to and in the same direction as any other information that is displayed on the same exterior surface of the package.

Subsection.Text: The declaration of net quantity and the common name of a tobacco product may be displayed on every primary package and secondary package.

The declaration of net quantity and the common name of a tobacco product may be displayed only once on each principal display panel, as defined in subsection 2(2) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations.

If the declaration of net quantity and the common name of a tobacco product are displayed on an exterior surface of a primary package or of a secondary package and a health warning is also displayed on that surface, the declaration and the common name must be oriented parallel to and in the same direction as the health warning.

If the declaration of net quantity and the common name of the tobacco product are displayed on an exterior surface of a primary package or of a secondary package and no health warning is displayed on that surface, the declaration and the common name must be oriented parallel to and in the same direction as any other information that is displayed on that surface.

Section.Text: In the case of a package that has a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, the declaration of net quantity and the common name of the tobacco product must be displayed in such a manner that the last letter of that information is 5 mm from the bottom and right edges of the package.

Section.MarginalNote: Text size and style — net quantity and common name

Subsection.Text: The declaration of net quantity and the common name of the tobacco product must be printed in characters whose height is no more than the minimum height of the numerical quantity in the declaration of net quantity set out in subsection 14(2) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations.
For the purposes of this section, height has the meaning assigned by subsection 14(1) of the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Regulations.

Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act or any other Act of Parliament, a leaflet must have a matte finish and the text that is displayed on it must be printed in a regular weight and width Lucida Sans Serif font style, without italics, and in either black on a white background or gray on a drab brown background.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Brand name — no colour or filter characteristic
Subsection.Text: A brand name that is not prohibited by the Act may be displayed on a leaflet in accordance with this section, if the brand name does not evoke a colour or a characteristic of a filter.

Subject to subsection 17(2), a leaflet must not display any image other than one that warns consumers of the health hazards arising from the use of the tobacco product or that provides instructions for its use.
Any statement respecting a risk arising from the use of the tobacco product may be printed in red.

Heading.TitleText: Standardized Physical Design Features and Type of Package

Section.Text: Every primary package that contains cigarettes must have a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, having six surfaces that meet at right angles and edges that are rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling.
A primary package that contains cigarettes must be a slide and shell package with a vertical opening.
A slide and shell package must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the only way to open it is by using the slide; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the edges of its upper slide-flap and lower slide-flap must be rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling, except at the corners that are concealed by the shell when the package is closed.

Subsection.Text: A slide and shell package that contains regular size cigarettes must have the following dimensions when it is closed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a height of no less than 72 mm and no more than 77 mm;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a width of no less than 81 mm and no more than 106 mm; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a depth of no less than 15 mm and no more than 18 mm.

Subsection.Text: A slide and shell package that contains king size cigarettes must have the following dimensions when it is closed:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a height of no less than 84 mm and no more than 89 mm;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a width of no less than 81 mm and no more than 106 mm; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a depth of no less than 15 mm and no more than 18 mm.

Subsection.Text: Every primary package and secondary package that contains cigarettes must be made of rigid cardboard.
However, a carton may be made of paper.
An overwrap that meets the requirements of sections 24 to 26 may be used, instead of a carton, to cover two or more primary packages that contain cigarettes.

Section.Text: Any lining that is placed in a primary package that contains cigarettes must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be made of one sheet of silver-coloured foil that is attached to white backing paper and to an interior surface of the package in such a manner that it cannot be removed without being damaged; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of paragraphs 23(b) to (d).

Section.Text: The declaration of the size of cigarettes as regular size or king size may be displayed on the exterior surface of the front and back of a primary package and of a secondary package and it must be printed in alphabetic characters of 10 points, oriented parallel to and in the same direction as the health warning and positioned in such a manner that the first letter of the declaration is 5 mm from the bottom and left edges of the package.

Subsection.Text: Every primary package that contains little cigars must have a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, having six surfaces that meet at right angles and edges that are rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling.
However, a primary package that is made of metal and contains little cigars — and any carton that contains such a primary package — may have rounded or beveled corners.
Every primary package that contains little cigars must be made of rigid cardboard or metal.
Every secondary package must be made of rigid cardboard.
However, a carton may be made of paper.
An overwrap that meets the requirements of sections 24 to 26 may be used, instead of a carton, to cover two or more primary packages that contain little cigars.

Section.Text: Any lining that is placed in a primary package that contains little cigars must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be made of one sheet of silver-coloured foil that is attached to white backing paper and to an interior surface of the package in such a manner that it cannot be removed without being damaged; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of paragraphs 23(b) to (d).

Section.Text: Despite these Regulations, a package is considered to be a primary package if it is intended for retail sale in Canada and cigars that are covered by overwraps are directly placed in it.

Subsection.Text: Any overwrap that covers a cigar must mould to the cigar and meet the requirements of paragraphs 24(b) to (d).
If an overwrap covers more than one cigar, the information and features referred to in section 25 may be displayed on the overwrap.

Section.Text: An overwrap that meets the requirements of sections 24 to 26 may be used, instead of a carton, to cover two or more primary packages that contain cigars.
Any lining that is placed in a primary package that contains cigars must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities, unless such features are necessary to hold the cigar in place or to remove it from the lining; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of paragraphs 23(a) to (c).

Heading.TitleText: Specific Requirements — Packages that Contain Devices or Parts Used with Devices

Section.Text: Despite these Regulations, a package is considered to be a primary package if it is intended for retail sale in Canada and a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product and that is covered by an overwrap is directly placed in it or a part that may be used with such a device and that is covered by an overwrap is directly placed in it.

Every primary package that contains a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product, or a part that may be used with such a device, must have a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, having six surfaces that meet at right angles and edges that are rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling.

Subsection.Text: Any overwrap that covers a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product, or a part that may be used with such a device, must mould to the device or part and meet the requirements of paragraphs 24(b) to (d).

If an overwrap covers more than one device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product or more than one part that may be used with such a device, the information and features referred to in section 25 may be displayed on the overwrap.

Section.Text: Any lining that is placed in a primary package that contains a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product, or a part that may be used with such a device, must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be made of plastic or rigid cardboard;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities, unless such features are necessary to hold the device or part in place or to remove it from the lining; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of paragraphs 23(a) to (c).

Section.Text: The exterior surfaces of a primary package and of a secondary package that contains a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product, or a part that may be used with such a device, may display instructions for the safe handling or storage of the device or part if the instructions

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: do not contain any promotion, image or design;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: are printed in characters of 10 points;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: are displayed, in both English and French, only once on the primary package and once on the secondary package;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: are displayed only on the exterior surface of any side of the package; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: are oriented parallel to and in the same direction as any other information that is displayed on the same exterior surface of the package.

Heading.TitleText: Specific Requirements — Packages that Contain Tobacco Products Intended for Use with Devices

Section.Text: Every primary package that contains a tobacco product that is made in whole or in part of tobacco and intended for use with a device that is necessary for the use of that product must have a rectangular cuboid shape when it is closed, having six surfaces that meet at right angles and edges that are rigid and straight, without any rounding or bevelling.

Any lining that is placed in a primary package that contains a tobacco product that is made in whole or in part of tobacco and intended for use with a device that is necessary for the use of that product must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities, unless such features are necessary to hold the product in place or to remove it from the lining; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of paragraphs 23(a) to (c).

Heading.TitleText: Specific Requirements — Packages that Do Not Contain Tobacco Products

Subsection.Text: If a manufacturer of a tobacco product furnishes a package so that a tobacco product may be directly placed in it after the product’s retail sale in Canada, the package must meet the requirements of these Regulations that apply to a primary package that contains the tobacco product, other than the requirements of subsection 14(3) and sections 23 and 32 to 37.

Despite subsection (1), if a manufacturer of a tobacco product furnishes a bag so that a tobacco product, primary package or secondary package may be placed in it after the tobacco product, primary package or secondary package is sold at retail in Canada, the bag must meet the requirements of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: section 9;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subsections 10(1) and (2);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: sections 11 and 12;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 13(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: subsection 14(1);

Paragraph.Label: (f)

Paragraph.Label: (g)

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: sections 17 to 19;

Paragraph.Label: (i)

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: subsections 22(1) to (4) and (7);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: sections 27 and 28;

Paragraph.Label: (l)

Paragraph.Label: (m)

Paragraph.Label: (n)

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Appearance and Dimensions of Tobacco Products

Section.Text: Subject to section 62, every tobacco product that is made of tobacco that is rolled in paper or in a wrapper composed of reconstituted tobacco must have a smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities.
A filter may have holes or recesses that are not visible.

Subsection.Text: A tobacco product may display an alphanumeric code if the code

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is printed only once on the tobacco product, in characters of no more than 8 points;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of subsection 15(1) and paragraph 15(2)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cigarettes, little cigars, cigars and tobacco products that are made in whole or in part of tobacco, rolled in paper and intended for use with a device, is oriented parallel to and displayed no more than 38 mm from the end of the product that is not designed to be lit or heated.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(a), instead of being printed on a cigar, the alphanumeric code may be printed on a cigar band that meets the requirements of subsection 71(4) if the code is displayed only once on the band and is printed in characters of no more than 10 points.
The alphanumeric code must not convey any information relating to characteristics of the tobacco product or its emissions.
The alphanumeric code must not evoke the tobacco product’s brand elements.
A tobacco product must not include any feature that is designed to permit access remotely to any promotion by a means of electronic communication.

The tobacco product may include a feature that is designed to permit access remotely to other types of information by a means of electronic communication if the feature becomes visible only through technological means or meets the requirements imposed by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province.

Section.Text: Cigarettes must have a diameter of no less than 7.65 mm and no more than 8.0 mm and must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no less than 70.0 mm and no more than 73.0 mm in length, in the case of regular size cigarettes; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no less than 82.0 mm and no more than 85.0 mm in length, in the case of king size cigarettes.

Section.Text: A cigarette must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the part of its filter, if any, that is visible under normal conditions of use must be white;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the paper that it is made of must be white and have a matte finish; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its tipping paper must have a matte finish and be white or imitate a cork pattern.

Section.Text: Despite section 61, the paper that a cigarette is made of, including any tipping paper, may have ventilation holes that do not form any word, image or design.
Little cigars must have a diameter of no less than 7.0 mm and no more than 8.5 mm.
A little cigar must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its mouthpiece or tip must have a matte finish and be white or drab brown;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the part of its filter, if any, that is visible under normal conditions of use must be white; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its tipping paper must have a matte finish and be white or drab brown, or imitate a cork pattern.

Section.Text: A cigar must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any mouthpiece or tip must have a matte finish and be white or drab brown; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any tipping paper must have a matte finish and be drab brown.

Subsection.Text: The following information may be displayed on a cigar if it is displayed on a band that is fitted around the circumference of the cigar and meets the requirements of this section:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a brand name that is not prohibited by the Act, if the brand name does not evoke a colour or a characteristic of a filter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s identity and principal place of business; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the country in which the cigar was manufactured.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in subsection (1) may be displayed only once on the band and must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a matte finish and be printed in a regular weight and width Lucida Sans Serif font style, in characters of no more than 10 points, without italics, and in gray; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be displayed horizontally along the length of the band such that the text runs around the circumference of the cigar.

Subsection.Text: A bar code may be displayed only once on the band and must meet the requirements of subsection 16(1) and paragraph 16(2)(a).
The band must be drab brown and have a matte finish and smooth texture, without any raised features, embossing, decorative ridges, bulges or other irregularities.

The band referred to in section 71 may be placed over another band that does not meet the requirements of these Regulations if it completely covers the other band and is attached to it by adhesive and in such a manner that it cannot be removed without the other band being damaged.
A band need not meet the requirements of these Regulations if it is completely covered, in accordance with subsection (1), by the band referred to in section 71.

Section.MarginalNote: Tobacco products used with a device

Subsection.Text: The requirements of section 66 apply to a tobacco product that is made in whole or in part of tobacco, rolled in paper and intended for use with a device.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Tobacco products not rolled in paper
Subsection.Text: A tobacco product that is made in whole or in part of tobacco and intended for use with a device but that is not rolled in paper must have a matte finish and be drab brown.

Section.Text: Despite section 61, any paper in which a tobacco product that is intended for use with a device is rolled, including any tipping paper, may have ventilation holes that do not form any word, image or design.

Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, the surfaces of a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product and of the parts that may be used with the device need not be the natural colour of the materials of which they are made.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided by or under the Act, any other Act of Parliament or any Act of the legislature of a province, a marking that is not a promotion may be displayed on a device that is necessary for the use of a tobacco product and on a part that may be used with the device.

However, a brand name that is not prohibited by the Act may be displayed on a device and on a part that may be used with the device if the brand name does not evoke a colour or a characteristic of a filter.

Section.Text: The part of a filter that is visible when the filter is used with a tobacco product under normal conditions of use must be white.
The requirements of paragraphs 66(a) to (c) apply to a tube that is intended for use with a tobacco product.

Subsection.Text: Any paper — other than tipping paper — that is intended for use with a tobacco product must have a matte finish and be white.
Despite section 61, the paper may have ventilation holes that do not form any word, image or design.

Section.Text: Any thread around the circumference of a bidi must be black.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, transitional period means

Paragraph.Text: in respect of all tobacco products and packages that contain tobacco products, including little cigars but no other cigars or packages that contain other cigars, the period beginning on the day on which these Regulations come into force and ending on the 90th day after that day; and

Subsection.Text: During the transitional period, a retailer may sell a package that contains tobacco products or a tobacco product that does not meet the requirements of these Regulations.
During the transitional period, a retailer may furnish a package or bag referred to in section 60 that does not meet the requirements of these Regulations.

Despite these Regulations, until the second anniversary of the day on which subsection 11(2) of An Act to amend the Tobacco Act and the Non-smokers’ Health Act and to make consequential amendments to other Acts, chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 2018, comes into force, a primary package that contains cigarettes may have edges that are rounded and beveled and not rigid and straight.

Subject to subsections (2) and (3), these Regulations come into force on the day on which subsection 11(2) of An Act to amend the Tobacco Act and the Non-smokers’ Health Act and to make consequential amendments to other Acts, chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 2018, comes into force.
